comments:
Hi,
The following test fails:
1. Create a UML2 model in an EMOF resource. - OK
2. Save the resource - OK
3. Load just saved model in another EMOF resource. - Fails

The model that is saved is:
============================================================================
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ASCII"?>
<uml:Package xmi:version="2.0" xmlns:xmi="http://www.omg.org/XMI" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:emof="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" xmlns:uml="http://www.eclipse.org/uml2/1.0.0/UML" xmi:id="_0" name="pack1">
  <ownedMember xsi:type="uml:Class" xmi:id="_0.@ownedMember.0" name="class0"/>
  <ownedMember xsi:type="uml:Class" xmi:id="_0.@ownedMember.1" name="class1"/>
  <ownedMember xsi:type="uml:Class" xmi:id="_0.@ownedMember.2" name="class2"/>
  <ownedMember xsi:type="uml:Class" xmi:id="_0.@ownedMember.3" name="class3"/>
  <ownedMember xsi:type="uml:Class" xmi:id="_0.@ownedMember.4" name="class4"/>
</uml:Package>
==============================================

The following code is used to load XMI:
           UML2PackageImpl.init();
            EMOFResourceImpl res = new EMOFResourceImpl(URI.createURI(path));
            res.load(null);

The test fails with the following exception:
==============================================
java.lang.NullPointerException

	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.createObjectByType(XMLHandler.java:729)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.createTopObject(XMLHandler.java:740)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.processElement(XMLHandler.java:444)

Could you please give me a solution.

Thanks in advance,

Andrey

This produces an error message with EMF 2.2, so I won't make any change the avoid the null pointer problem.

This resource implementation is only designed to work for saving Ecore as EMOF and for loading EMOF as Ecore.  Since UML2 isn't EMOF and can't be saved as EMOF, I'm not sure what you are expecting this to do.  You should use a resource created by UML2Resource.Factory.INSTANCE to load and save UML2 resources.
